message.content:
cs.GT, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.MA 

This paper deals with game theory and learning in games, which are central topics in the field of theoretical computer science. The paper specifically focuses on partial monitoring games, which are a subfield of game theory. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.GT (Computer Science - Game Theory and Economics). The paper also uses tools from machine learning and information theory, which makes cs.LG (Computer Science - Learning) and cs.IT (Computer Science - Information Theory) likely categories as well. Additionally, the paper discusses the construction of strategies, which is a topic in artificial intelligence, making cs.AI (Computer Science - Artificial Intelligence) a possible category. Finally, the paper deals with regret minimization, which is a topic in multi-agent systems, making cs.MA (Computer Science - Multiagent Systems) a possible category as well.
